author: Ben Cohen
title: The Cruelest Two Minutes of the Olympics for Team USA
text:
GANGNEUNG, South Korea—They were two minutes that explain why NBC pays billions of dollars for Olympic rights: Mikaela Shiffrin at the gate and Nathan Chen on the ice at the exact same time late Thursday, with an enormous television audience waiting for their coronations.
Shiffrin was skiing the event she dominates and trying to become the only back-to-back slalom champion in history. Chen was skating his short program to put himself in prime contention to be the youngest men’s individual gold medalist in more than a half-century....
